Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black (mostly worn); exterior: slip partly worn; painted decoration consisting of palmette-filled lotus; elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For other chalices with floral patterns on the exterior surface, see British Museum 1924,1201.428 and 1924,1201.521 which Lemos identifies as belonging to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Simple Animal Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1005) (phase 2)
